name: Brad Pitt
famous_fact: Won an Oscar in 2020 for his role as Cliff Booth in 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.'

name: John F. Kennedy, JFK
famous_fact: 35th President of the United States and decorated World War Two veteran.

name: Rachel Brosnahan
famous_fact: Won multiple Golden Globes for playing The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel.

name: Milla Jovovich
famous_fact: While she's now best known for her action movie roles, she signed her first modeling contract at the age of 12.

name: Pedro Pascal
famous_fact: This Chilean-born actor is best known to science fiction fans as The Mandalorian.

name: Peter Dinklage
famous_fact: He increased an already-growing fan following when he took on the role of Tyrion Lannister in 'Game of Thrones.'

name: Buster Keaton
famous_fact: Classic comedic actor who got his start in silent films.

name: George Washington
famous_fact: The first President of the United States, he was inaugurated in New York in 1789, the year before Washington D.C. was founded.

name: Tony Curtis
famous_fact: Born Bernard Schwartz, he changed his name to Tony Curtis after getting signed to a 7 year contract by Universal in the late 1940s

name: Marilyn Monroe
famous_fact: Star of 'The Misfits' and 'Some Like It Hot,' her short career propelled her to Hollywood icon status.

name: Michael B Jordan
famous_fact: Playing Erik Killmonger in 'Black Panther' was not his first Marvel role. Three years earlier, he played Johnny Storm in 'The Fantastic Four.'

name: Oprah Winfrey
famous_fact: In 2003, Forbes Magazine recognized her as the first African American Female to reach billionaire status.

name: Madam CJ Walker
famous_fact: Founder of a successful cosmetics company, serving the African American community, she is the first American woman to become a self-made millionaire.

name: Serena Williams
famous_fact: A former #1 tennis player in the world and winner of over 20 grand slam singles titles.

name: Jerry Lawson
famous_fact: This African American engineer led the team that invented the video game cartridge.

name: Jackie Robinson
famous_fact: This famed baseball player was the first African American to play in the major leagues.

name: Bill Gates
famous_fact: This Microsoft co-founder and occasional richest man in America also co-founded the philanthropic Giving Pledge with investor Warren Buffett.

name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
famous_fact: She is the youngest woman elected to Congress, and during her first term, was the youngest member of Congress.

name: Doctor Ellen Ochoa
famous_fact: An American astronaut, she is the first Hispanic woman to go into space and has logged over one thousand hours orbiting the earth.

name: Doctor Chien-Shiung Wu
famous_fact: Emigrating to America in 1939 to pursue a doctorate at Berkeley, she worked on the Manhattan Project and won the inaugural Wolfe Prize for physics.

name: Bruce Lee
famous_fact: Famous teacher of the martial arts and international movie star in films like 'The Big Boss' and 'Enter The Dragon.'

name: John Boyega
famous_fact: He gained international star status playing Finn in the third 'Star Wars' trilogy.

name: Lady Gaga
famous_fact: In 2010, she wore a dress made of raw beef to the Video Music Awards show. The dress is so famous, it has its own Wikipedia page.

name: Sting
famous_fact: He's claimed even his mother and children now call him Sting. The name came from a former bandmate who thought his yellow and black outfits made him look like a bee.

name: Tom Hiddleston
famous_fact: 'Thor' director Kenneth Branagh invited Tom to audition for his breakout role as Loki after having worked with him in theater and TV projects in the UK.

name: Jimin
famous_fact: This Korean superstar is a big education booster, donating hundreds of thousands of dollars to help children with school expenses.

name: Michelle Yeoh
famous_fact: This action legend has become a sci-fi legend in recent years, joining the 'Star Trek' and 'Avatar' franchises.

name: Joseph 'Reverend Run' Simmons
famous_fact: This pioneering hip-hop star is the Run in Run DMC and was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2009

name: Gal Gadot
famous_fact: After winning the Miss Israel pageant, this 'Wonder Woman' star served two years in the Israeli military as a combat fitness instructor.

name: Kamala Harris
famous_fact: She is the first female Vice President of the United States and the first U.S. Vice President of African or Indian ancestry.

name: Sandra Day O'Connor
famous_fact: She is not only the first female justice to serve on the U.S. Supreme Court, she was the first woman to serve as Majority Leader in the Arizona State Senate.

name: Margaret Thatcher
famous_fact: She is not only the first female Prime Minister of the UK, but she was the longest-serving UK Prime Minister of the 20th century.
